div.div: The Manager sends messages from Drivers to Interfaces and from Interfaces to the Relay Controller. It also selects Drivers and Scripts based on the user's selection in the GUI.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 128px; height: 1px; padding-top: 660px; margin-left: 211px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: The controller GUI is accessible through a web browser. It allows the user to change the selected Driver, Script, and connected Relay on the fly.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 208px; height: 1px; padding-top: 725px; margin-left: 611px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: Additional scripts are included with Vibrance. Users can also write their own scripts with Python using a vibrance.Interface object.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 58px; height: 1px; padding-top: 280px; margin-left: 771px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: Additional drivers are included with Vibrance. Users can also write their own drivers with Python by subclassing the vibrance.Driver class.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 768px; height: 1px; padding-top: 60px; margin-left: 46px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div: This is a diagram of the Vibrance software as configured for the three demos included in the video I produced.
The path taken between Vibrance receiving input and an animation being displayed (during the Ableton Live demo) is shown in red. This entire pipeline takes only a few milliseconds.

switch.text: This is a diagram of the Vibrance software as configured for the three demos included in the video I produced....

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 228px; height: 1px; padding-top: 120px; margin-left: 41px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: This is the part that users (i.e., the people whose devices will display the animation) will interact with.

switch.text: This is the part that users (i.e., the...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 138px; height: 1px; padding-top: 355px; margin-left: 31px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: In the Ableton demo, the artist only needs to worry about Ableton Live while Vibrance is running.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 358px; height: 1px; padding-top: 120px; margin-left: 481px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: The Relay Server broadcasts each message from the controller to all applicable clients. If all client devices are on the same LAN, it can be hosted on-site. Otherwise, to circumvent NAT, it could be hosted in a cloud VM/VPS with a public IP address.

switch.text: The Relay Server broadcasts each message from the controller...

a.text: Viewer does not support full SVG 1.1
